intro: Hesperolinon didymocarpum, commonly known as the two-seeded hesperolinon, is a rare and unique plant species belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels. The plant produces two small, oval-shaped seeds within its fruit, which is a dry, two-lobed capsule. Hesperolinon didymocarpum is native to specific regions in southern Africa, where it thrives in sandy or rocky soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
